head.title: How a Blush Wine Is Like a Prom Date

hedline.hl1: How a Blush Wine Is Like a Prom Date

abstract.p: Howard Goldberg reviews Alba Vineyard's New Jersey Blush wine; photo (M)

block.p: A blush wine is simply a rose by another name. If there's a distinction, it's only poetic: Blush is associated with youth; rose implies a few more drops of maturity. By this definition, Alba Vineyard's New Jersey Blush is accurately named.

First, its bright salmon-coral color has the verve of a new gown for a high school prom. Second, its flirtatious bouquet of berries, tea roses and candy has the charm of a corsage pinned on the gown. Third, it ''misbehaves'': you are teased into expecting sweetness, but the wine comes dry.

A blush wine is simply a rose by another name. If there's a distinction, it's only poetic: Blush is associated with youth; rose implies a few more drops of maturity. By this definition, Alba Vineyard's New Jersey Blush is accurately named.

First, its bright salmon-coral color has the verve of a new gown for a high school prom. Second, its flirtatious bouquet of berries, tea roses and candy has the charm of a corsage pinned on the gown. Third, it ''misbehaves'': you are teased into expecting sweetness, but the wine comes dry.

This pop wine (not vintage-dated but coming from 1999 grapes) was made Rudy Marchese, an owner of the 18-year-old Alba, in Finesville, Warren County. It is an agreeable sipper for lunchtime in the backyard or at the beach -- a guzzler, for some -- that easily substitutes for many white zinfandels filling merchants' shelves.
''New Jersey Blush is produced from Marechal Foch,'' a red French hybrid that flourishes in the Northeast, and from ''the rieslinglike hybrid developed by Cornell, Cayuga white,'' Mr. Marchese said.

In a homey touch, the label, depicting a painting by the artist Dan Campanelli, shows ''one of the many historic buildings in the rural villages surrounding the vineyards from which this wine is produced,'' the bottle says.
The wine costs $7 at Alba, which can identify stores and restaurants throughout the state that carry it.

Alba Vineyard, 269 Route 627, Finesville; (908) 995-7800; fax, (908) 995-7155. Open Saturdays, 11 A.M. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays and Thursdays, noon to 5 p.m., and Fridays, noon to 7 p.m. Credit cards accepted; shipment only inside New Jersey.
